content:
(a) Magnetic field lines show the direction (at every point) along which a small magnetised needle aligns (at the point). Do the magnetic field lines also represent the lines of force on a moving charged particle at every point?

(b) If magnetic monopoles existed, how would the Gauss's law of magnetism be modified?
summary: This text discusses magnetic field lines, how they represent the direction along which a small magnetised needle aligns, and if they also represent the lines of force on a moving charged particle. It also questions the existence of magnetic monopoles and how the Gauss's law of magnetism would be modified if they existed.
hypothetical_questions: 1. Do Magnetic Field Lines Represent the Lines of Force on a Moving Charged Particle?
